ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: No indeed! He is obdurate about Our Signs.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Never. He is refractory of Our signs.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: By no means; he is stubbornly opposed to Our Signs.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Never will he receive more. He has been hostile to Our revelations.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Never! For he is an enemy to Our signs!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Nay! Verily, he has been opposing Our Ayat.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: By no means! surely he offers opposition to Our communications.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Nay! He is forward unto Our signs;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Nay! For lo! he hath been stubborn to Our revelations.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: By no means! He has been stubbornly hostile to Our revelation:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: By no means! Verily he hath been Unto Our signs a foe.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: No indeed! He is an obstinate opponent of Our signs.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: By no means! For to Our Signs he has been refractory!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Nay! Verily, he has been stubborn and opposing Our Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Not at all! Surely, he has been disobedient to Our verses.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: By no means! He was stubborn towards Our revelations.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: No! Indeed, he has been toward Our verses obstinate.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [74:16] Nay!, I shall not give him more than that. He is indeed stubborn to Our signs, [to] the Qur’ān.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: 706 (Nay!) I will not give him more. And since then his wealth kept decreasing. (For lo! He) i.e. al-Walid Ibn al- Mughirah (hath been stubborn to Our revelations) to Our Scripture and Messenger; he turned away from them in disbelief.
